title: Thea Hunt, 8, becomes English Heritage CEO to make dreams come true for UK kids
text:
3

English Heritage has discovered what the wishes of the country's children are - and appointed a girl of eight as CEO to make them come true.
A survey it conducted revealed that England's kids most want to discover hidden treasure, be a King or Queen for the day and sit on a throne.
Potentially the youngest 'CEO' in the country, Thea Hunt beat stiff competition from hundreds to help these wishes become reality at various heritage sites across the land.
Potentially the youngest CEO in the country, Thea Hunt, 8, beat off stiff competition from hundreds to help bring these venues alive for youngsters during their holidays
English Heritage thought who better to make the dreams of youngsters come true than to appoint a child to give a kid-eye view at English Heritage's castles, forts and palaces across England this summer
The nationwide search saw the West Midlands-schoolgirl compete against 500 applicants for the role of English Heritage's Child Executive Officer.
Successful Thea Hunt, said: 'Being able to audition at my local heritage site, Kenilworth Castle, really inspired me – I felt like a real-life Knight!
'I'm so excited to be English Heritage's CEO and can't wait to see the faces of children and their families when they're doing the events from our History Wish List.'

Ever wanted to own a Greek island? Experts predict... Her strategy is to tackle the list of the greatest dreams children have, determined through the survey.
Almost a quarter of children (24 per cent) stated they wished they could travel back to Roman times with the age of the Vikings (20 per cent) and the Victorian era (14 per cent) their second and third choices respectively.
Unsurprisingly over half of children (51 per cent) said if they were King or Queen for the day, they would impose a homework ban on birthdays.
You're hired! The nationwide search saw the West Midlands-schoolgirl compete against 500 applicants for the role of English Heritage's Child Executive Officer
TOP HISTORY WISHES OF CHILDREN 1. Discover hidden treasure
2. Be a King or Queen for the day
3. Sit on a throne
4. Fire a cannon
5. Build a fort
6. Sword fight with your friends
7. Battle pirates
8. Conquer a castle
9. Put on a suit of armour
10. Fire an arrow in the air
Source: English Heritage
To support the young officer in her new role a Round Table panel of seven children will be on hand to help make the 'History Wish List' a reality.
Emily Sewell, Head of Events at English Heritage, said: 'Over 500 children applied for the role and we interviewed 50 very strong candidates.
'But Thea really stood out with her passion, energy and generosity – we're extremely excited to have her on board.'
The targeted sites include Dover Castle, Pendennis Castle in Cornwall, Audley End House and Gardens in Essex, and also Stonehenge and Hadrian's Wall.
The job isn't without perks too. As CEO Thea will enjoy free life membership of English Heritage, and will be able to consult on English Heritage's summer events programme.
Thea's passion for the subject began at an early age, and the plucky historian wishes she could be a knight.
'It would be great to take part in a knights' tournament and feel how scary it really was charging to the opponent,' she said.
'I think there should be girl knights too because girls also have passion and drive and energy. That's why I would like to be a knight for the day.'
